headline: Local organization attends Ukrainian refugee summit in Ohio
author: Brandon Jaces
sentences: (WKBN) — Governor Mike DeWine held a summit near Cleveland with local agencies to talk about what they could do for Ukrainian refugees settling in Ohio on Thursday.
We’re going to walk them through the help that they need and get them in touch with the agency that’s going to help them,” said executive director Chaney Nezbeth.
Nezbeth said it was an honor to be included in the summit, and they could see refugees in Ohio anywhere from weeks to months from now.
“We’ve always said if there’s something that someone needs and we can’t help them we’re not going to just give them a phone number.
Their executive director said it was sort of like a networking event to see what resources were out there.
“Let me make it very very clear: Ohio welcomes and will welcome any refugees who come from Ukraine.
We are a state that was built by immigrants,” said Ohio Governor Mike DeWine.
The Way Station out of Columbiana County was one of those organizations.
They talked about what they could do and who could do what.
We are a nation of immigrants.
